metadata.title: CVE-2018-1333 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
By specially crafting HTTP/2 requests, workers would be allocated 60seconds longer than necessary, leading to worker exhaustion and a denial ofservice. Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.34 (Affected2.4.18-2.4.30,2.4.33).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1333` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4').
